Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 6 Moreover , all - polymer solar cells based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors exhibited power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 1.5% ( AM1.5 , 100 mW cm^-2 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) |
| based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors |
| and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors |
| as high as 1.5% |
| AM1.5 |
| 100 mW cm^-2 |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) |
| of all - polymer solar cells based on blends of |
| polythiophene derivative donors |
| and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors |
| as high as 1.5% |
| under AM1.5 |
| with an intensity of 100 mW cm^-2 |

Note: I assumed "AM1.5" refers to a standard solar spectrum and "100 mW cm^-2" refers to the intensity of the light used in the measurement. Both are relevant to measuring the material property of power conversion efficiency in solar cells.
